data.name: TextPortion
desc: A TextPortion is a piece of text within a paragraph that does not contain changes of its attributes inside.
It is created by an enumeration implemented in a paragraph service. It may be used to export the content of the paragraph to an external document format.

properties.name: Bookmark
desc: contains the bookmark of a text portion of type Bookmark.

properties.name: ControlCharacter
desc: contains the control character of a text portion of type ControlCharacter.

properties.name: DocumentIndexMark
desc: contains the document index mark of a text portion of type DocumentIndexMark.

properties.name: Footnote
desc: contains the footnote of a text portion of type Footnote.

properties.name: InContentMetadata
desc: contains the text range of a text portion of type InContentMetadata.

properties.name: IsCollapsed
desc: contains whether the portion is a point only.

properties.name: IsStart
desc: contains whether the portion is the start of the portion.
This is used for portions which are represented by 2 TextPortion objects (e.g., DocmentIndexMark).

properties.name: ReferenceMark
desc: contains the bookmark of a text portion of type ReferenceMark.

properties.name: TextField
desc: contains the text field of a text portion of type TextField.

properties.name: TextPortionType
desc: contains the type of the text portion.
For Reference marks, document index marks, etc., 2 text portions will be generated, one for the start position and one for the end position.
